intro: Capnoides juncea, commonly known as the narrow-leaf capnoid, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Capnoides juncea is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
